channel.title: All Bills
channel.description: A list of all bills published on Bills Online

item.title: London Local Authorities
item.description: To confer further powers upon local authorities in London; and for related purposes.

item.title: Bournemouth Borough Council
item.description: To confer powers on Bournemouth Borough Council for the better control of street trading in the borough of Bournemouth.

item.title: Broads Authority
item.description: To confer further powers on the Broads Authority; to make other provisions as to that Authority; and for related purposes.

item.title: Manchester City Council
item.description: To confer powers on Manchester City Council for the better control of street trading in the city of Manchester.

item.title: Transport for London (Supplemental Toll Provisions)
item.description: To confer further powers upon Transport for London; and for related purposes.

item.title: Leeds City Council
item.description: To confer powers on Leeds City Council for the better control of street trading in the city of Leeds.

item.title: Canterbury City Council
item.description: To confer powers on Canterbury City Council for the better control of street trading and touting in the city of Canterbury.

item.title: London Local Authorities and Transport for London (No. 2)
item.description: To confer further powers upon local authorities in London and upon Transport for London; and for related purposes.

item.title: Nottingham City Council
item.description: To confer powers on Nottingham City Council for the better control of street trading in the city of Nottingham.

item.title: Reading Borough Council
item.description: To confer powers on Reading Borough Council for the better control of street trading and touting in the borough of Reading.

item.title: Political Parties and Elections
item.description: To make provision in connection with the Electoral Commission; and to make provision about political donations and expenditure and about elections.

item.title: Beverley Freemen
item.description: To re-state and extend the categories of person entitled by birthright to be enrolled as a Freeman of Beverley; to extend the area within which entitlement to be a Pasture Freeman may arise; to modify legislation relating to such entitlement; and for related purposes.

item.title: City of Westminster
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the control of street trading and touting in the City of Westminster.

item.title: Business Rate Supplements
item.description: A Bill to confer power on the Greater London Authority and certain local authorities to impose a levy on non-domestic ratepayers to raise money for expenditure on projects expected to promote economic development; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Saving Gateway Accounts
item.description: A Bill to make provision about Saving Gateway accounts; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Marine and Coastal Access
item.description: A Bill to make provision in relation to marine functions and activities; to make provision about migratory and freshwater fish; to make provision for and in connection with the establishment of an English coastal walking route and of rights of access to land near the English coast; to enable the making of Assembly Measures in relation to Welsh coastal routes for recreational journeys and rights of access to land near the Welsh coast; to make further provision in relation to Natural England and the Countryside Council of Wales; to make provision in relation to works which are detrimental to navigation; to amend the Harbours Act 1964; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Local Democracy, Economic Development and Construction
item.description: To make provision for the purposes of promoting public involvement in relation to local authorities and other public authorities; to make provision about bodies representing the interests of tenants; to make provision about the procedures of local authorities and the audit of entities connected with them; to establish the Boundary Committee for England and to make provision relating to local government boundary and electoral change; to make provision about local and regional development; to amend the law relating to construction contracts; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Banking (No. 2)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about banking.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords
item.description: To make provision for the appointment of a Commission to make recommendations to the Crown for the creation of life peerages; to restrict membership of the House of Lords by virtue of hereditary peerage; to make provision for permanent leave of absence from the House of Lords; to provide for the expulsion of members of the House of Lords in specified circumstances; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: House of Lords (Members' Taxation Status)
item.description: To make provision about the taxation status of Members of the House of Lords.

item.title: Corporation Tax
item.description: Restate, with minor changes, certain enactments relating to corporation tax; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Equal Pay and Flexible Working
item.description: To amend the Equal Pay Act 1970; and to make provision about flexible working.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Disabled Persons (Independent Living)
item.description: To impose duties upon certain persons and bodies in respect of disabled persons; to confer certain rights upon disabled persons for independent living; to amend the Mental Health Act 1983; to amend the Health and Social Care Act 2008; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Cohabitation
item.description: A Bill to provide certain protections for persons who live together as a couple or have lived together as a couple; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Dog Control
item.description: To make provision about the control of dogs and their welfare; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Consolidated Fund
item.description: To authorise the use of resources for the service of the years ending with 31 March 2009 and 31 March 2010 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the years ending with 31 March 2009 and 31 March 2010.

item.title: Coroners and Justice
item.description: A Bill to amend the law relating to coroners and to certification and registration of deaths; to amend the criminal law; to make provision about criminal justice and about dealing with offenders; to make provision about the Commissioner for Victims and Witnesses; to make provision relating to the security of court and other buildings; to make provision about legal aid; to make provision for payments to be made by offenders in respect of benefits derived from the exploitation of material pertaining to offences; to amend the Data Protection Act 1998; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Bank of England (Amendment)
item.description: To amend the objectives of the Bank of England in relation to monetary policy.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Companies’ Remuneration Reports
item.description: To make provision about remuneration reports in public quoted company accounts and reports.

item.title: Child Poverty
item.description: A Bill to set targets relating to the eradication of child poverty, and to make other provision about child poverty.

item.title: Policing and Crime
item.description: Make provision about the police; to make provision about prostitution, sex offenders, sex establishments and certain other premises; to make provision for reducing and dealing with the abuse of alcohol; to make provision about the proceeds of crime; to make provision about extradition; to amend the Aviation Security Act 1982; to make provision about criminal records and to amend the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006; to confer, extend or facilitate search, forfeiture and other powers relating to the United Kingdom’s borders or elsewhere; to make further provision for combatting crime and disorder; to repeal redundant provisions; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Equality
item.description: Make provision to require Ministers of the Crown and others when making strategic decisions about the exercise of their functions to have regard to the desirability of reducing socio-economic inequalities; to reform and harmonise equality law and restate the greater part of the enactments relating to discrimination and harassment related to certain personal characteristics; to enable certain employers to be required to publish information about the differences in pay between male and female employees; to prohibit victimisation in certain circumstances; to require the exercise of certain functions to be with regard to the need to eliminate discrimination and other prohibited conduct; to enable duties to be imposed in relation to the exercise of public procurement functions; to increase equality of opportunity; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Geneva Conventions and United Nations Personnel (Protocols)
item.description: To amend the Geneva Conventions Act 1957 so as to give effect to the Protocol additional to the Geneva Conventions of 12 August 1949 done on 8 December 2005; and to amend the United Nations Personnel Act 1997 so as to give effect to the Optional Protocol to the Convention on the Safety of United Nations and Associated Personnel adopted by the General Assembly of the United Nations on 8 December 2005

item.category: Registration of births, deaths and marriages
item.title: Welfare Reform
item.description: Amend the law relating to social security; to make provision enabling disabled people to be given greater control over the way in which certain public services are provided for them; to amend the law relating to child support; to make provision about the registration of births; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Community Amateur Sports Clubs (Support)
item.description: To make provision in respect of Community Amateur Sports Clubs; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Borders, Citizenship and Immigration
item.description: To provide for customs functions to be exercisable by the Secretary of State, the Director of Border Revenue and officials designated by them; to make provision about the use and disclosure of customs information; to make provision for and in connection with the exercise of customs functions and functions relating to immigration, asylum or nationality; to make provision about citizenship and other nationality matters; to make further provision about immigration and asylum; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Online Purchasing of Goods and Services (Age Verification)
item.description: To make it a requirement for the providers of goods and services and the providers of specified facilities enabling the purchase of such goods and services to take reasonable steps, in certain circumstances, to establish the age of customers making such purchases remotely; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Torture (Damages)
item.description: To make provision for actions for damages for torture; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Health
item.description: To make provision about The NHS Constitution; to make provision about health care (including provision about the National Health Service and health bodies); to make provision for the control of the promotion and sale of tobacco products; to make provision about the investigation of complaints about privately arranged or funded adult social care; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Fuel Poverty
item.description: A Bill to make further provision about fuel poverty; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Autism
item.description: A Bill to make provision about meeting the needs of adults with autistic spectrum conditions; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Statutory Redundancy Pay (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to provide for a mechanism for statutory redundancy pay which links it to average weekly earnings; and for connected purposes

item.title: Small Business Rate Relief (Automatic Payment)
item.description: A Bill to require small business rate relief payments to be made automatically; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Royal Marriages and Succession to the Crown (Prevention of Discrimination)
item.description: A Bill to make provision to remove discrimination in respect of Royal marriages and succession to the Crown.

item.title: Co-operative and Community Benefit Societies and Credit Unions
item.description: To make provision for societies to be registered as co-operative or community benefit societies and to re-name the Industrial and Provident Societies Acts; to apply to registered societies the provisions relating to directors’ disqualification and to make provision for the application of certain other enactments relating to companies; to confer power to make provision for credit unions corresponding to any provision applying to building societies; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Green Energy (Definition and Promotion)
item.description: A Bill to define the term “green energy”; to promote its development, installation and usage; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Scottish Banknotes (Acceptability in United Kingdom)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the acceptability of Scottish banknotes throughout the United Kingdom; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Leaseholders Rights
item.description: A Bill to confer rights on leaseholders relating to the management and maintenance of their properties; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Protection of Children (Encrypted Material)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000 to increase the penalty where a person fails to comply with a notice requiring disclosure of protected material where it is likely that the material contains an indecent photograph of a child or where the offender has been previously convicted of a sexual offence involving images of children; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Children in Care (Custody)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the services provided by local authorities in relation to the care of children in care in custody; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Palliative Care
item.description: A Bill to confer on patients a right to choose where to receive palliative care; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Organ Donation (Presumed Consent)
item.description: A Bill to provide for an organ donation scheme based upon presumed consent; to make provision in relation to safeguards for such a scheme; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Schools (Health Support)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Education and Inspections Act 2006 to establish standards in schools for the support of children with specified health conditions; to make provision about the inspection of such support; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Presumption of Death
item.description: A Bill to make provision in relation to the presumed deaths of missing persons; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Lending (Regulation)
item.description: A Bill to impose requirements on lenders relating to the calculation of interest rates; to regulate the promotion of lending; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Industrial Carbon Emissions (Targets)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the establishment of carbon emissions performance targets for electricity generating stations; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Equality and Diversity (Reform)
item.description: A Bill to prohibit the use of affirmative and positive action in recruitment and appointment processes; to repeal the Sex Discrimination (Election Candidates) Act 2002; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Special Educational Needs and Disability (Support)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for further training of teachers and specialist staff; to make requirements relating to access to specialist services; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Forces Widows Pensions (Equality of Treatment)
item.description: A Bill to provide for the equal treatment of forces widows’ pensions in respect of retirement from military service for the periods before 1973 and between 1973 and 2005; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Law Commission
item.description: To make provision in relation to the Law Commission.

item.title: Pharmaceutical Labelling (Warning Of Cognitive Function Impairment)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for a warning symbol to be prominently displayed on the packaging of pharmaceuticals which act on the brain and central nervous system so as to impair dangerously the consumer’s ability to carry out certainactivities; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Employers’ Liability Insurance Bureau
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the creation of an employers’ liability insurance bureau comprising an electronic database and a fund of last resort; to make provision about employers’ liability insurance; and for connected purposes

item.title: British Museum Act 1963 (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the British Museum Act 1963 to permit the transfer of artefacts in the British Museum; to confer powers on the Secretary of State to require the transfer of artefacts in specified circumstances; and for connected purposes

item.title: Damages (Asbestos-Related Conditions)
item.description: A Bill to provide that certain asbestos-related conditions are actionable personal injuries; and for connected purposes

item.title: Land Use (Gardens Protection Etc)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the protection of gardens and urban green spaces; and for connected purposes

item.title: Holocaust (Return of Cultural Objects) (formerly known as Holocaust (Stolen Art) Restitution)
item.description: A Bill to provide for the transfer from public museum and gallery collections of arts, artefacts and other objects stolen between 1933 and 1945 by or on behalf of the Nazi regime, its members and sympathisers; to provide for the return of such artefacts and objects to the lawful owners, their heirs and successors; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Crown Employment (Nationality)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for and in connection with the removal of general restrictions as to nationality which apply to persons employed or holding office in any civil capacity under the Crown; and for connected purposes

item.title: Torture (Damages) (No. 2)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for actions for damages for torture; and for connected purposes

item.title: Illegally Logged Timber (Prohibition Of Sale)
item.description: A Bill to prohibit the sale in the United Kingdom of timber and wood products that were obtained or produced illegally in their country of origin; and for connected purposes

item.title: Human Rights Act 1998 (Meaning Of Public Authority)
item.description: A Bill to clarify the meaning of ‘public authority’ in section 6 of the Human Rights Act 1998

item.title: Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day
item.description: A Bill to introduce a national day to learn about and remember the Armenian genocide

item.title: Broadcasting (Television Licence Fee Abolition)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the abolition of the television licence fee; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Sovereignty Of Parliament (European Communities)
item.description: A Bill to provide that Community treaties, Community instruments and Community obligations shall only be binding in legal proceedings in the United Kingdom insofar as they do not conflict with a subsequent, expressly inconsistent enactment of the Parliament of the United Kingdom.

item.title: European Union (Audit of Benefits and Costs of UK Membership)
item.description: A Bill to establish a Commission to carry out regular audits of the economic costs and benefits of the UK’s membership of the European Union; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Drugs (Roadside Testing)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for roadside testing for illegal drugs; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Pedlars (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Pedlars Act 1871

item.title: Broadcasting (Public Service Content)
item.description: A Bill to define public service content for the purposes of public service broadcasting

item.title: Safety Of Medicines (Evaluation)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the evaluation of methods of testing the safety of medicines; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Employment Rights
item.description: A Bill to provide that, notwithstanding the European Communities Act 1972, workers or members of a trade union who are UK nationals shall have rights of employment in the United Kingdom equal to or as favourable as those afforded to foreign nationals or conferred by the United Kingdom Parliament.

item.title: Protection of Garden Land (Development Control)
item.description: A Bill to protect private gardens from development which is out of character with the surrounding area; to make provision about the circumstances in which a planning application may be rejected by a local authority and about rights of appeal in such circumstances; to prohibit repeated planning applications in certain circumstances; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Home Repossession (Protection)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Law of Property Act 1925 to require a mortgagee to obtain the court’s permission before exercising the power of sale, where the mortgaged land consists of or includes a dwelling-house; to make certain powers available to the court in actions by mortgagees for possession of a dwelling-house; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Exercise of Reasonable Discretion
item.description: A Bill to provide that public authorities and public servants shall not be subject to any criminal or civil penalty as a result of the exercise of reasonable discretion in the performance of their functions; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Sports Grounds Safety Authority
item.description: To confer further powers on the Football Licensing Authority and to amend its name; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Apprenticeships, Skills, Children and Learning
item.description: Make provision about apprenticeships, education, training and children’s services; to amend the Employment Rights Act 1996; to establish the Young People’s Learning Agency for England, the office of Chief Executive of Skills Funding, the Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation and the School Support Staff Negotiating Body and to make provision about those bodies and that office; to make provision about the Qualifications and Curriculum Authority; to make provision about schools and institutions within the further education sector; to make provision about student loans; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Employment Opportunities
item.description: A Bill to introduce more freedom, flexibility and opportunity for those seeking employment in the public and private sectors.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Climate Change (Sectoral Targets)
item.description: A Bill to set targets relating to energy generation and consumption; to make provision for the sectoral targets to be met; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Northern Ireland
item.description: Make provision in relation to policing and justice in Northern Ireland; and to amend section 86 of the Northern Ireland Act 1998

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Airport Expansion (Parliamentary Approval)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Planning Act 2008 to require Parliamentary approval for proposals for the building of new major airports and additional runways at existing major airports; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Postal Services
item.description: To make provision for the restructuring of the Royal Mail group and about the Royal Mail Pension Plan; to make new provision about the regulation of postal services; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Driving Instruction (Suspension and Exemption Powers)
item.description: A Bill to provide for the suspension in certain circumstances of registration and licences relating to the provision of driving instruction; to make provision about exemptions from prohibitions concerning registration (including provision about suspension); to make provision about compensation in connection with suspension; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Renewable Content Obligation
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the establishment of minimum levels of recyclates in designated products and classes of product; to establish a scheme for the certification of designated products; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Employment Retention
item.description: A Bill to make provision for a statutory right to an employment retention assessment to determine entitlement to a period of rehabilitation leave for newly disabled people and people whose existing impairments change; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Teaching of British History in Schools
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the compulsory teaching of British history in schools; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Industry and Exports (Financial Support)
item.description: A Bill to amend section 8(5) of the Industrial Development Act 1982 and to amend section 1(1) of the Export and Investment Guarantees Act 1991

item.title: Consolidated Fund (Appropriation)
item.description: To Authorise the use of resources for the service of the years ending with 31 March 2008 and 31 March 2009 and to apply certain sums out of the Consolidated Fund to the service of the years ending with 31 March 2008 and 31 March 2009; and to appropriate the supply authorised in this Session of Parliament for the service of the years ending with 31 March 2008 and 31 March 2009.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Bankers' Pensions (Limits)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the pensions of board members of banks that are wholly or partly in public ownership to be limited in certain circumstances; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Theft from Shops (Use of Penalty Notices for Disorder)
item.description: A Bill to restrict the use of penalty notices for disorder in respect of the offence of theft from retail and commercial premises; to revise sentencing guidelines in respect of this offence; to make provision for the recording on a national database of penalty notices for disorder issued; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Protection of Shareholders
item.description: A Bill to make provision for each public company to establish a shareholders’ committee; to make provision about the membership, functions and operation of the committee; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Food Labelling Regulations (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Food Labelling Regulations 1996 to provide for information about the country of origin of food to be made available to consumers; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Young People Leaving Care (Accommodation)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for minimum standards in respect of accommodation for young people leaving care; to impose a duty on local authorities to ensure that such standards are met; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Short Selling and Bank Accounts
item.description: A Bill to prohibit short selling; to require disclosure by pension funds and their trustees of records of loans of their shares for the purpose of short selling, and of the fees received in such cases; to require banks and building societies to offer their retail customers current and savings accounts free of any charge for holding the accounts when such accounts are in credit; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Pension Credit and Personal Expense Allowance (Duty of Consultation and Review)
item.description: A Bill to make provision for the periodic review of the capital limits and tariff income rules and the personal expense allowance; to make provision for consultations on the level of those allowances and rules; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Finance
item.description: A Bill to grant certain duties, to alter other duties, and to amend the law relating to the National Debt and the Public Review, and to make further provision in connection with finance.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Cohabitation (No. 2)
item.description: A Bill to provide certain protections for persons who live together as a couple or have lived together as a couple; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Constitutional Renewal
item.description: To repeal sections 132 to 138 of the Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005; to make provision relating to the Attorney General; to make provision relating to the ratification of treaties and to participation in armed conflict by the United Kingdom; to make provision relating to the civil service; to make provision relating to parliamentary general elections; to make provision relating to the conduct of members of Parliament; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Council Tax Rebate
item.description: A Bill to rename council tax benefit council tax rebate; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Perpetuities and Accumulations
item.description: To amend the law relating to the avoidance of future interests on grounds of remoteness and the law relating to accumulations of income.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Registration of Births and Deaths (Welsh Language)
item.description: A bill to make provision about the registration of births and deaths where particulars are given in Welsh and English; to permit certificates of particulars of entries of registers of births and deaths to be in Welsh or English only in such circumstances; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Insolvency (Provision of Information to Employment Agencies)
item.description: A Bill to require insolvency practitioners to provide information regarding redundancies to employment agencies when a company goes into administration within a specified period; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Cheapest Energy Tariff (Information)
item.description: A Bill to amend the law relating to the regulation of domestic energy providers; to require an energy company to publish on invoices information indicating whether the customer is on the cheapest tariff offered by that company, based on pattern of energy use, and the savings to be gained from any switch to this tariff; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Protection of Children (Publicity)
item.description: A Bill to prevent the exploitation by parents of their children by means of seeking publicity, primarily for the purpose of financial gain, in respect of the actions of such children; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Prevention of Excessive Charges
item.description: A Bill to prevent excessive charges or fees from being levied on consumers; and for connected purposes

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Sale of Mobile Homes (Interview)
item.description: A Bill to make provision about the holding of interviews between site owners and prospective purchases of mobile homes prior to any sale.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Developing Country Debt (Restriction of Recovery)
item.description: A Bill to regulate the recovery of the defaulted sovereign debt of developing countries; and for connect purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Surface Water and Highway Drainage Charges (Exemption)
item.description: A Bill to require water companies to exempt from surface water and highway drainage charges places of worship, non-profit making sports clubs, scout groups and guide associations; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Goalpost Safety
item.description: A Bill to make provision for minimum standards for football goalposts.

item.title: School Bus (Safety)
item.description: A Bill to make requirements relating to the design and operation of school buses; to make provision about road safety training for drivers and users of school buses; to establish a School Bus Safety Council; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Marine Navigation Aids
item.description: To establish a Marine Navigation Aids Commission; to establish an Office of Marine Navigation Aids Regulation; to amend the Merchant Shipping Act 1995; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Commission for the Compact
item.description: A Bill to place the Commission for the Compact on a statutory basis; to confer powers on the Commission; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Bailiffs (Repeals and Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to make requirements in respect of the use of force and forcible entry by bailiffs; to make provision for the reference to court of certain cases involving vulnerable clients; and for connect purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (Starting in the House of Lords)
item.title: Constitutional Reform
Sustainable Communtities Act 2007 (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to amend the Sustainable Communities Act 2007 to make further provision regarding the consideration of proposals and the representation of parish councils; and for connect purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Maximum Wage
item.description: A Bill to prescribe the maximum wage that can be paid; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Citizens' Convention (Accountability and Ethics)
item.description: A Bill to set up a Citizens' Convention for the purposes of establishing minimum standards of ethics for Members of Parliament and for promoting the involvement of citizens in political decision making; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Road Signs (Tourist Destinations and Facilities)
item.description: A Bill to impose duties on the Highways Agency and other public authorities to promote tourism by providing or permitting to be provided appropriate road signage; and for connected purposes.

item.title: Fuel Poverty (No.2)
item.description: A Bill to make further provision about fuel poverty; and for connected purposes.

item.category: Private Members' Bill (under the Ten Minute Rule, SO No 23)
item.title: Gangmasters Licensing Act 2004 (Amendment)
item.description: A Bill to apply the provisions of the Gangmasters Licensing Act 2004 to the construction industry; and for connected purposes.
